results.title: Erosion: levelling the land
results.creator_credit: H William Varney, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Uses laboratory demonstrations and natural photography to investigate the processes of weathering, erosion and deposition of rock materials. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Waves on water
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Gary Lopez and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Uses large experimental tanks to show that waves approaching shore bend to conform to the coastline. Also points out that high energy waves are created by underwater earthquakes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles L. Finance, Gary Lopez and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Rocks that originate underground
results.creator_credit: Charles L. Finance, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Explains the formation of typical igneous and metamorphic rocks and the conditions under which they are formed according to indirect evidence. Also, the program investigates the requirements for the formation of intergrown crystalline mineral grains. Suitable for Upper Primary and Lower Secondary.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles L. Finance, Stanley Croner and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Cultural conflict
results.creator_credit: David Zweck and Country Education Project
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English for H.S.C. students”.
A program of interviews and discussions led by Peter Couchman. The texts “Mister Johnson” (Joyce Carey), “The Inheritors” (William Golding), “A Place Apart” (Dervla Murphy) and “The Immigrants” (Wendy Lowenstein and Morag Loh) are considered in examining the causes of cultural conflict, how people are affected by it, how conflict can both enrich and impoverish individuals and communities and how conflict is resolved. Also appearing are Dr. M. McLaughlin and Charles D’Aprano.
results.description:
Episode of Series “English for H.S.C. students”.

results.title: Heartbeat of a volcano
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Illustrates the measurement of volcano and earthquake activity and changes in the shape of volcanoes. Shows the stages of volcanic activity leading to a major eruption. Provides excellent, detailed footage of a giant eruption in Hawaii.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Communicating change
results.creator_credit: Diane Sundin, Australia Post and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English at work”.
This program examines the issues of managing change in the workplace. It shows the importance for everyone in the workplace to understand what changes are going to happen, why they are happening and how everyone will be affected by them.

results.title: Mars the Viking Mission
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Earth science series”.
Looks at the five successful American missions to Mars that have taken place since 1964, discussing how advances in photography have improved scientists’ ability to identify small features on Mars. Also discusses the work performed by two laboratories which have been landed on Mars to analyse soil, test for existence of life and record weather conditions.

results.title: Prostate disease
results.creator_credit: Diane Sundin, Peter Campbell, Merck, Sharp and Dohme and Special Broadcasting Services
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “English at work”.
This program looks at the early symptoms of prostate problems, how many men react to these and what men need to do to prevent prostate cancer. An excellent progam to encourage men to have check ups at an early stage of problems. Partly dramatised.
